DataElement.preferredName: Amino Acid Sequence Change ALK Tyrosine Kinase Receptor Detection Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the amino acid sequencing change(s) detected in the ALK tyrosine kinase receptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amino Acid Sequence Change ALK Tyrosine Kinase Receptor Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The sequence of amino acids along a polypeptide chain._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:ALK tyrosine kinase receptor (1620 aa, ~176 kDa) is encoded by the human ALK gene. This protein is involved in ligand binding, tyrosine phosphorylation and signal transduction._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.
